channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ペン・エンタテインメントがESPNに現金15億ドルを支払い、10年間で5億ドルの新株予約権を提供することで合意し、バースツールからESPNベットを設立（Nathan Bomey/Axios）
item.description:
Nathan Bomey / Axios:
Penn Entertainment launches ESPN Bet, switching from Barstool, after agreeing to pay ESPN $1.5B in cash and provide $500M in stock warrants over 10 years  —  - ESPN, which also got $500 million in Penn stock warrants, agreed to actively promote ESPN Bet throughout its network.

item.title: 調査：地元のニュースソースを装った英国のサイトのネットワークが、有料プレスリリースを編集コンテンツとして表示し、GoogleニュースやMSNに掲載される（Will Dunn/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Will Dunn / Press Gazette:
Investigation: a network of UK sites masquerading as local news sources display paid-for press releases as editorial content that ends up on Google News and MSN  —  Paid-for press releases ending up displayed as news on Google News and MSN.  —  A network of websites that present themselves …

item.title: 技術系YouTuberのMarques Brownleeのプロフィールとインタビュー。技術系ガジェットのレビューをどのように変えたか、ビジネス戦略、1770万人の購読者達成などについて語る（Harry McCracken/Fast Company）
item.description:
Harry McCracken / Fast Company:
A profile of, and interview with, tech YouTuber Marques Brownlee on how he changed tech gadget reviews, business strategy, reaching 17.7M subscribers, and more  —  Marques Brownlee has rewired the way people shop for gadgets—and how companies sell them.  Inside the humble workshop …

item.title: モデルで投資家のカーリー・クロスが、イギリスのファッション雑誌「i-D Magazine」をヴァイス・メディア・グループから買収する計画。クロスが経営するベッドフォード・メディアがi-Dの親会社となる。
item.description:
Diana Pearl / Business of Fashion:
Model and investor Karlie Kloss plans to acquire UK fashion outlet i-D Magazine from Vice Media Group; Kloss' Bedford Media will become i-D's parent company  —  With the acquisition, the model will become i-D's CEO.  —  Karlie Kloss, the model turned investor and entrepreneur …

item.title: ガーディアンは、2023/24年度の米デジタル読者収入は3300万ドル（約57％）を見込んでおり、総収入の20％弱を占める見込み（Sara Fischer/Axios
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
The Guardian expects $33M in US digital reader revenue in FY 2023/24, or ~57% of its US revenue, which is expected to be a little less than 20% of total revenue  —  The Guardian expects to make $33 million in digital reader revenue in the U.S. for its fiscal 2023/2024 year — a new record.

item.title: ナイト財団は、2024年1月からアルベルト・イバルグの後任として、ガネット・メディア社長のマリベル・ペレス・ワズワースを次期社長兼CEOに指名した。
item.description:
Sarah Scire / Nieman Lab:
The Knight Foundation names Gannett Media President Maribel Perez Wadsworth as its next president and CEO, starting in January 2024, succeeding Alberto Ibargüen  —  The John S. and James L. Knight Foundation has named the newspaper executive Maribel Perez Wadsworth its next president and CEO.

item.title: Defector、2023年の売上高は前年比18％増の450万ドル、うちサブスクリプション収入は375万ドル、アクティブ加入者数は4万人超、営業費用合計は440万ドル（Defector調べ）
item.description:
Defector:
Defector reports 2023 revenue up 18% YoY to ~$4.5M, including $3.75M from subscriptions, 40K+ active subscribers, and ~$4.4M in total operating expenses  —  Purpose of this report  —  More than three years into the company's existence, Defector continues to have no outside investors and no intention of raising outside capital.

item.title: 調査：独立系ドイツ人ジャーナリスト、フーベルト・ザイペルがプーチン関連者から60万ユーロを受け取り、プーチン本を執筆。
item.description:
The Guardian:
Investigation: independent German journalist Hubert Seipel received ~€600K from a Putin associate to support his Putin books, described by many as sympathetic  —  Influential author and broadcaster Hubert Seipel received financial support for his work on two books described by many as sympathetic to Russian president

item.title: NPR記者によると、ヨルダン川西岸のデイル・イスティヤでパレスチナ人農民を取材中、ドローンが上空を旋回し、イスラエル軍が銃を向けたという。
item.description:
NPR:
NPR journalists say a drone hovered above them and Israeli forces aimed a gun at them while they interviewed a Palestinian farmer in Deir Istiya, the West Bank  —  WEST BANK - There are days when you head out to report a story, and you think you know where it's going.  And then it spins in an entirely different direction.

item.title: TikTokは、ユーザーがアプリからSpotify、Apple Music、Amazon Musicに曲を保存できるようになった。
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
TikTok now lets users save songs from the app to Spotify, Apple Music, and Amazon Music, initially launching for US and UK users, with more markets to follow  —  TikTok has long touted the app as a place to discover new music — and its ability to propel songs into viral hits.

item.title: 現地メディアロシア、2006年にモスクワでロシア人ジャーナリスト、アンナ・ポリトコフスカヤさんを殺害した罪で2014年に有罪判決を受けた男を恩赦、その見返りはウクライナでの戦闘（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
Local media: Russia pardons a man convicted in 2014 for murdering Russian journalist Anna Politkovskaya in Moscow in 2006, in return for fighting in Ukraine  —  A man convicted over the murder of the Russian journalist Anna Politkovskaya, best known for reporting on abuses in Russia's war …

item.title: BBCによると、2006年から2008年までラジオ番組の司会を務めていたラッセル・ブランドの言動について、5件の苦情が寄せられた。
item.description:
BBC:
The BBC says five complaints have been made about Russell Brand's behavior while he hosted radio shows from 2006 to 2008; two were made in the past two months  —  The BBC has said a total of five complaints have been made about Russell Brand's behaviour while he hosted radio shows between 2006 and 2008.

item.title: テンセント・ミュージック、第3四半期の売上高は前年同期比10.8％減の9億ドル（予想8億6500万ドル）、純利益は同15.6％増の1億7300万ドル、有料ユーザーは同20.8％増の1億300万人（ロイター
item.description:
Reuters:
Tencent Music reports Q3 revenue down 10.8% YoY to ~$900M, vs. ~$865M est., net profit up 15.6% YoY to ~$173M, and paying users up 20.8% YoY to 103M  —  China's Tencent Music Entertainment (1698.HK) beat estimates for third-quarter revenue on Tuesday, helped by steady growth in paid subscriptions on its music streaming platform.

item.title: ヘンリー・ブロジェットがInsiderのCEOを退任し、バーバラ・ペンが後任に。Insiderは社名をBusiness Insiderに戻し、ビジネスとテクノロジーのニュースに特化する（Alexandra Bruell/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Alexandra Bruell / Wall Street Journal:
Henry Blodget steps down as Insider's CEO, replaced by Barbara Peng; Insider changes its name back to Business Insider to focus on business and technology news  —  Publisher changes name back to Business Insider, with Barbara Peng to succeed Blodget as CEO  —  Henry Blodget …

item.title: CBSは2024年2月中旬に脚本シリーズを復活させる計画で、暫定合意後にストライキ後のスケジュール計画を打ち出した最初のネットワークとなる（John Koblin/New York Times）。
item.description:
John Koblin / New York Times:
CBS plans to bring back scripted series in mid-February 2024, becoming the first network to lay out post-strike scheduling plans after the tentative agreement  —  The announcement is the first from a network about its plans since a tentative agreement was reached last week to end Hollywood's strikes.
